reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to be in the middle of town this is the place to be. We had room 101, first floor overlooking the Grand Rue. The room was spacious, the bathroom was good apart for the hair dryer and the bed(s) were very comfortable (we had twin beds pushed together with each bed separately made!). We didn't have breakfast there thinking that 12 Euro each was too much-so can't comment on it. The town is lovely, with history surrounding you. Would certainly stay here again should we find ourselves in Colmar again. We walked from the train station with our bags and it was an easy flat 15 minute walk with plenty of advice on where the hotel is.
reviews.title: Great location Beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rode into Colmar (by motorcycle) and St Martin is obviously THE Place to be in downtown Colmar. It was nearly full so we were offered one of the 'special' rooms with a view over the square and a lot of space in the room - which for motorcycle travelers is much appreciated: VERY nice. The price was reasonable for the location and quality, to be honest.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location implies that there is no secluded parking space for the bikes. Not a huge problem but the bikes will be parked up against the facade of the the hotel.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel is in a great location in the center of the most elegant of old towns I have seen. We parked on a nearby car park. 500 yards away and followed the signs to this hotel The car park has a number of free spaces but is very busy. The hotel room we had has been restored to a very high standard and a very nice balcony overlooking a court yard. We sat and enjoyed some local wine , bought from one of the many wine shops nearby. Considering the top location we thought the price was reasonable at £80 per night. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are many great restaurants to try. A great place to rest on our way to Italy I would not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in Fairy Tale Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at the St. Martin late last month. It was such a charming place. The building was built in the 1600's but the rooms were updated and comfortable. We had room 16 that had a balcony with flowers in boxes overlooking the square. When you got tired of walking around the beautiful village, it is fun to go and sit out on the balcony and just people watch.
reviews.title: Best location in Colmar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate to be able to spend a delightful four days at the Hotel Saint Martin, Colmar, France as a base for our first ever visit to the Alscae region of France. This very comfortable, hospitably run hotel combines some newly upgraded rooms fronting on the Grand Rue and more traditional rooms in an adjoining structure with a courtyard in between. The room in which we stayed was large, airy, very neat and clean. The hotel provided a sumptuous breakfast (extra charge), free coffee and wifi, and excellent support for investigating and booking side trips and tours of the Alsace region.
reviews.title: Four Day visit of Alsace Region based in Colmar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We celebrated New Year's Eve here and it was a lovely experience. We had a quiet room(except for the fun fireworks at midnight!) in the building off the central courtyard. This room(#1) was a good size for two people with two beds together and even room for a small sofa. The bathroom was recently redone and was nicely equipped, although the hairdryer was not very powerful. The small courtyard made for a pretty scene out our windows, but we could see that during warmer months it might be a smoking area. Check with the hotel first if smoke is an issue.
reviews.title: Lots of charm and nice service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful. We needed reservations for New Year's Eve but they told us we would have to check out the restaurants ourselves. We would have liked some help with this, but other than that they were kind and answered all other questions and concerns. We had our own bottle on New Year's and they happily provided glasses and an ice bucket.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast one morning and although it was nice, it was pricey. There are many wonderful patisseries (one right next door) in the area that are perfect for croissants and coffee and much less expensive. We highly recommend J. C. Clergue for a lovely place to sit and enjoy your morning coffee.
reviews.title: Excellent location and a fine hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very convenient place to stay in Colmar and the hotel is warm, cozy and comfortable. It made the ideal place to wander the Christmas market and charming areas surrounding it. We would recommend taking a cab from the train station. We did walk there to purchase tickets later and it is a nice walk, but a bit far dragging a bag behind.
reviews.title: A room as cute as the town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This lovely hotel is situated right in the centre of Colmar, near the Cathedral and may good restaurants. The hotel as lovely comfortable rooms and although the building is very old the rooms are clean and comfortable and well modernised. The breakfasts were good and the staff friendly and efficient Lovely shower in huge bathroom. My only tiny whinge is that the reading lamp by the bed was not very efficient.
reviews.title: Comfort in the sentre of Colmar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ideally located in the centre of charming Colmar, our 4 night stay at the beginning of June was excellent. Good room, nice staff. Breakfast costs extra but is well worth it, with a good selection.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Already planning our return as its good value
reviews.title: Old Alsace Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a room that was in the old building, so the decor reflected the old Alsatian feel. The bathroom had a huge tub and hand held shower but no shower curtain. That was annoying since water splashed all over the floor and I had to wipe it up, lest we slip and fall with all that water. Bedding was decent but not the most comfortable when compared to other accommodations in the same price range. Location is great since it's in the center of old town with easy access to all the main attractions, albeit a bit far from the train station--just remember to pack light. And depending on who's at the front desk, you may be dealing with staff or manager who may be less than hospitable or lacking in friendly smiles.
reviews.title: loved our balcony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: charmingly decorated room in Colmar. we spent three nights here in room #15. bed was two twins pushed together, still very comfortable. good bedding and pillows, room equipped with fridge, safe, cabinet for clothes storage and desk. our room had a large balcony overlooking the street on the side of the hotel. it was a little rainy while we were here, but nothing was gonna stop us from taking advantage of our outdoor seating! hotel is a bit of a hike from the train station--about a 20 minute walk, but once you are there it is close to all the sites and shopping.
reviews.title: Decent base for a visit to Colmar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel offered a great room (#2), looking on to the courtyard: quiet, spotlessly clean, good airconditioning as it was hot. The front desk people were very helpful. My wife and I were here for 3 nights, coinciding with the opening of the Colmar Music festival -- we had tickets, and discovered that the main concert venue was just 75 yards away, plus half the orchestra's musicians were staying at our hotel, so we had good morning conversations. The breakfast buffet was fine. Several reasonably-priced restaurant/brasseries right out the front door. Colmar is wonderful, a couple of Michelin-starred restaurants, but the food everywhere is great. Handy to explore the Route du Vin: the first villages are just 15 minutes away. The bathroom, by the way, was huge, modern, and completely clean.
reviews.title: Heart of Colmar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Colmar is a beautiful town and Hotel St Martin, located right in the thick of the pedestrianised centre, carries the traditional French charm indoors into its tasteful rooms.
reviews.title: Graceful hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were quiet, with air-con available and good wifi throughout.
reviews.title: Nice unit with a great balcony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a free car park 150m from the hotel, but we were warned that it wasn't always safe to leave your car here overnight (we were fine though). There is a secure pay car park a little further away.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in Colmar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many great places to eat in Colmar. The hotel breakfast is expensive but countless nearby cafes are availble,
reviews.title: Handy location and nice staff
